Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl S
Reviews.Content: Dear Fabiola, I just wanted to send a note to say how much we enjoyed our stay at Lunata. We were there for 3 nights and we ended up staying on the top floor in the Jr. Suite. (Europa room??) We had stayed at another hotel the night before and had to move as it was SO noisy from the disco on the beach. Your hotel was a wonderful, peaceful haven to go to. It was spotlessly clean, offered a continental breakfast each morning, you gave us beach towels to use, and we were greeted each day with a smile. There was plenty of hot water and great water pressure. The price was reasonable. We loved our deck facing the back courtyard and spent time out there sipping a drink and chatting in peace and quiet. The location is perfect on the main avenue but you feel like you are miles away as it is so peaceful. The free internet was a bonus too. We won't hesitate to recommend your hotel and it will be our first choice should we return to the Mayan Riviera. Thank-you, Cheryl Ottawa, Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Tess28Chicago_USA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us and was exactly what we expected, Quiet and clean, no surprises. We had never been to Playa Del Carmen and this was a good place to start. It's right on the main street,5th avenue, and very close to the beach. There is a continental breakfast served in the morning. To me this is important since I don't like to have to find a restaurant first thing in the morning for a cup of coffee. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but lousy manager”
Reviews.Author: Honestfeedback2u
Reviews.Content: We had difficulty with the manager, an older lady and not Kristen who was very friendly. We had a rental car and as the hotel is on a pedestrian only street,we had to park, find the hotel, ask where the nearest parking lot was, go back to the car, find that lot, then come back to the hotel and check in. No porter or anyone to help schlep the bags. Apparently it was porters day off. Manager at check in was rude when I asked her to write down name of parking lot. Here's a bright idea let people know about lot and location ahead of time when you take credit card information. I paid the entire room fee in cash at check in but was asked to give my credit card as a deposit. When I asked why the hotel needed a deposit when I had just paid in full things got nasty. The manager seemed outraged at what I considered a reasonable question. How audacious a guest questioning a confusing policy! She snapped it was due to the minbar which had about $5. USD worth of stuff in it. During my stay I was greeted with sneers while my partner got smiles. At check out, again no porter I told her I found her most inhospitable. She retorted that she found me disrespectful at check in. I replied that it is my right to ask a reasonable question and that Mexico is a democracy and perhaps she should work in Saudis Arabia. I reminded her that I was the guest and spending money at her hotel and not the other way round. Great hotel, I would stay again and just hope the owners had the good sense to fire her, and promote Kristin. Let people know in advance where your parking arrangements are and where. At 135 USD have someone there to help guests with bags to and from lot, at check out i had to hire my own bicycle richshaw driver as the manager could care less. Lesson three: don't hassle guests and loose all goodwill for $5 worth on minibar stuff. We are not all theives! Plus the hotel already had my credit card info from check in. Manager made a point of telling me maid had already checked minibar and that nothing was missing! Manager is getting too long in the tooth and it shows. Good hotel lousy manager.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, great location”
Reviews.Author: lorettam55
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Lunata Hotel from another hotel because we wanted a more quiet location, and were tired of living out of our suitcases due to lack of storage space. We were totally happy with the Lunata and would go there again. The rooms are beautiful, large, and clean. We had access to a more-than-adequate continental breakfast under a palapa in the garden. With only ten rooms, It was like staying in a Mexican hacienda. The Lunata is located on 5th Avenue and a very short walk to the beach and the Fusion Beach Bar and Restaurant, where guests get a 10 per cent discount and rent their chairs at a very reasonable price. The staff were very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Beautiful, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaGreene
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect, sitting a block from the ocean. The Spanish tile is gorgeous, the employees are beyond accommodating and the garden is beautiful. Hotel Lunata is in the heart of Playa del Carmen but at night the rooms remain quiet. What a lovely little villa, you won't regret booking Lunata!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: snow1935
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient, very clean and staff helpful in every way. We will use this hotel when we visit Playa in the future. There is a simple breakfast. The floors are scrubbed every day, sheets changed each day and we felt very safe. We were there with family and the hotel extended every courtesy. The hotel is close to the beach, about one block away, and the hotel has an outside shower to use after going to the beach. Staff made arrangements for tours and made arrangements for a taxi back to the airport at the end of our stay. The mattresses were well protected and clean, very firm which we liked, the rooms are air-conditioned and plenty of hot water in the large walk-in showers. We had a balcony with table and chairs overlooking the garden area and there seemed to always a breeze so it was a comfortable area for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place will return”
Reviews.Author: Vancouverraised
Reviews.Content: Great little 10 room Boutique Hotel, very clean, Friendly Staff, only noise was from the beach parties blocks away, glad I am not staying on the beach. Can;t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: Galdalal
Reviews.Content: You'll get a lot for your money and spend the rest in sleep :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrzej M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Lunata on my way to Belize.Perfect location in the middel of Playa del Carmen.Hotel is very nice,clean good value.In the courtyard they serve breakfast.Very friendly staff,wouldstay again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for couples”
Reviews.Author: dfmedrano
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifull. It has the Mexican Hacienda Style. Rooms are carefully decorated and lit to provide a calm atomosphere. It is located on the 5ht Avenue so you are close to the action in Playa. Breakfast is served on the garden and is perfect for starting your day. The only drawback was some noise from nearby bars at night because our room faced the street. But it was manageable. Maybe the rooms in the back are quieter

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: wanttotravelmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight in June 2011 as a stopover on the way to Belize from Cancun. The hotel was very clean and neat. The front desk was quick and efficent. The location was great for us, as it was a one night stopover - night in Playa del Carmen. 1 block from the beach and right among many great restaurants. The court yard was very nice, but we didn't sit there. There is no parking on site and we needed to park our car 1 block away. There is one computer with internet that we were able to use for free. We would stay here again overnight, but not long term as I perfer a quieter area away from town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, but know what you are booking.”
Reviews.Author: Mangocatpurring
Reviews.Content: This property is right in the middle of 5th avenue in Playa del Carmen. I would suggest only for experienced travelers. Boutique property that is super cute. Myself and some girlfriends stayed for a couple nights. You can walk down to the great public beach. Shops and restaurants galor. Cute, clean rooms. Had a courtyard where they served breakfast in the morning. This is not a Mexico resort vacation. This property is in the middle of a town and no restaurant or frills on site. The transfer driver has to drop you off down the street and you have to pull your luggage in. The road is used only by pedestrians. Always use Olympus Tours for transfer and tours in Mexico. They are not connected to any time shares, they are trust worthy and honest. Would stay here again in a second we loved it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for the price, horribly hard bed.”
Reviews.Author: Hicksox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of of honeymoon and loved absolutely everything about the hotel... except for the bed. We live in Mexico 6 months out of the year so I am fully aware that the beds are different here then in the US, but this bed was hard even by Mexican standards. Other then that, this hotel is easily a 5. The location in Playa can't be beat and the staff was awesome. They can't do enough to help you and were very helpful for suggestions on food, beaches, etc. If you can stand the hard bed, you won't find a better hotel for the money anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Its like staying with extended family”
Reviews.Author: ryanlap75
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step into the courtyard you have flashes of days gone by and that you have just walked into your family's home. The staff was very kind and welcoming. Always able to offer ideas, tips on how to navigate around the city. We were surprised to be present during a Carnivale parade that came down 5th Ave on our last night in town. It was truly amazing. The night was full of life and energy. With the hotel being a block and half away from the beach is an incredible deal.

Reviews.Title: “A treat and a treasure”
Reviews.Author: whatsinaname50
Reviews.Content: First of all 5th Avenue is crazy!! That being said Hotel Lunata while on 5th is quiet, beautiful and extremely peaceful. The staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating. We loved our room and our balcony - we stayed on the back facing the lush courtyard. Breakfast was good and satisfying. The breakfast area is a friendly gathering place and was perfect to meet the other guests and exchange stories and tips. Free internet was perfect for us since we did not have our computer with us - no time limit and no line-ups. We felt like we were staying in an oasis. We highly recommend this hotel. The beds are a little hard but we have slept on much harder in Mexico. Sun and fun makes sleeping easier.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy boutique hotel with great free internet”
Reviews.Author: bjornharvold
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Lunata for 10 days. I had stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for a week and Illusion Hotel before, as well as rented an apartment there for a week. I worked there the whole time I visited and my first priority is always a good internet connection. Lunata had the best of all the places I stayed. For the price and location as well as great staff and service, I highly recommend Lunata to any fellow travelers thinking about heading down to Playa del Carmen, Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful sanctuary on busy 5th Avenue”
Reviews.Author: kayseejay
Reviews.Content: We started our trip at a hotel on the beach, but the noise from all-night bars kept us awake, literally all night. Exhausted, we checked out the next morning and decided to stop into the Hotel Lunata. The minute we stepped into the hallway leading to the quiet garden courtyard, we felt a flush of relief. Fortunately, they had a room for us, and were so wonderful about taking care of us. There were two couples in our group, we had a room overlooking 5th Avenue and they had a room overlooking the garden. Neither of us had any problem with noise, since the Lunata has installed not one, but two double paned glass doors leading to the outside. The room was comfortable, the bed was softer than the one at our other hotel and very nice. Television, a refrigerator and other amenities made our stay perfect. The atmosphere at the hotel is cozy and the colors and tiles are very warm and give an authentic Mexican feel. Breakfast was adequate-nothing to rave about, but enough to get you going at the beginning of the day. When you walk out the front door, you are right in the middle of the action on 5th Avenue, just around the corner from the beach, and easy walking distance to anywhere you would want to go. We will definitely stay there again, and cannot say how much we appreciated the comfortable and quiet Hotel Lunata, after a sleepless night on the noisy beach.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: joesindorf
Reviews.Content: We love the Yucatan - and at some point in every trip we find ourselves in Playa del Carmen. It's either to grab the ferry to dive in Cozumel or the port of entry after flying into Cozumel and driving south to the less populated areas of this beautiful coastline. On our first visit to Playa, we just happened upon the Lunata whilst walking along 5th Ave doing some shopping after dinner. Stepping off the street into the courtyard was like stepping back in time. We instantly felt refreshed, cooler, pampered. We agreed to stay here next time in Playa, but when that time came, we forgot the name of the place. Again, we just happened to find it online - after much searching - and stayed. It was a wonderful time. One that we heartily recommend. However, there are some things you should know: - it's not on the beach (just a block away, but it is not a beach hotel) - it is on 5th Ave (which is very busy) - parking is a block or two away - you will need to carry your baggage to the hotel from your car or taxi - there is no elevator - there is no restaurant (but tons within a block) - there is no pool (the beach is a block away) But it has style and is beautiful. If you want to relax and enjoy Playa, and be within steps of the great shopping and eating on 5th Ave - this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel not built for comfort”
Reviews.Author: drgnfly30
Reviews.Content: We'd seen the Lunata on previous trips & found it to be charming, we wanted to experience some time in PDC at a non-AI so we booked two nights at the Hotel Lunata before checking into the Valentin Imperial Maya for the remainder of our trip. The hotel itself is indeed charming. Wonderful attention to detail. The colors & tilework compliment the atmosphere and add to the ambience. The room was clean and well kept. Again, the colors, decor, tile work all proving an authentic feel. We thankfully booked a garden view room. It proved very peaceful during the day. It was a third floor room great for the view, not so much for the long hot walk up to your room. That's were I have to stop my praises. The bed... it was literally the most uncomfortable bed we have ever experienced. It was a mattress on a concrete slab. By the end of our stay I was referring to it as Hotel Bedrock instead of the Lunata. But I guess it didn't matter how comfortable the bed was because even having a garden side room, the noise from 5th Ave was intolerable. Music until 5:30am! Partiers yelling at all hours echoing throughout the stairwell up to our room. I can't imagine what it would have been like on the other side.. we probably would have checked out. I wanted to experience the area without the cocoon of an AI and I did. But I found that AI or not, I have some dealbreakers that I will no longer compromise on ~ comfortable beds being top on that list!

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous and totally unreasonable cancellation policy”
Reviews.Author: kstenger
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled to spend several nights at the Hotel Lunata, however due to a serious family medical emergency, we were unable to fly to Mexico. I notified the hotel that I wanted to change our dates of stay, and were informed that they would be charging my credit card for one night's stay. I gave the hotel 4 days notice, but was informed (quite rudely) that they needed 15 days notice. The manager (Amira) informed me that they would be happy to change our reservation for us when we do finally make it down to PDC which is laughable. Alternatively, our second hotel in Cozumel, Casa Viento, was happy to accommodate us and kindly told me they would reschedule us with no argument whatsoever. Hotel Lunata...we were looking forward to staying with you but now that I'm looking at a charge on my credit card statement (how very compassionate!) you can kiss any future business with us goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BillandBob
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Playa del Carmen and my second stay at Hotel Lunata. I feel, as a solo traveler, very safe at this hotel and love the women who staff the reception area. They are kind and have a way of making guests feel special. The location is perfect, close to the beach and away from restaurants and bars. The hotel is surrounded by shops so the noise is less than other parts of calle 5. I've stayed in the same room, Biana which is on calle 5 and slept well. I even had the window open one night. And, there are earplugs available. Everything is at your fingertips, from the beach to restaurants. The garden is a wonderful respite from the crowd. All in all, the hotel makes for a wondfully relaxed vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, colorful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Henttan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights in the end of January. Walked in and had a pretty good discount. Lovely, colorful hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Good location. Quiet and big room (garden side) with comfy beds. The best thing was the central A/C which worked just perfectly. Continental breakfast was nothing to mention about and over all the breakfast area could be more inviting. The garden wasn't very green and the plastic tables with chairs in the garden were worn out.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, what a great find.... The best little hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: schnooky700
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Playa and have to say this place is great. I live in the NYC area and have been around the world. This place is just what you want in a local hotel in the center of it all. See the web site it says it all. NO BS..

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much we're going back!”
Reviews.Author: johnhdesign
Reviews.Content: t's been two years since we honeymooned in Playa del Carmen staying at Hotel Lunata for two weeks and we always long to go back. This little jewel of a hotel was the perfect place for us. The staff is very personable and eager to help. The rooms were clean and well appointed and since there is only ten rooms the staff really gets to know you. We were given great advice for where to eat and what to do. Though Lunata is not on the beach it is only a short 2 minute walk around the corner. We used the advice of another Lunata reviewer which was to pay the $3 U.S. to use a lounge chair and palaypa at Hotel Fusion. Food and drinks at Fusion are very reasonable and the staff there was extremely attentive and nice. We strongly prefer going to Hotel Lunata and Fusion over the large all-inclusive resorts. After reading others review about the noise level in the rooms from the street below we were a little nervous and had no problem sleeping. Things really quiet down around 10 p.m.. The continental breakfast held in the garden area of the hotel was good with plenty of offerings. On la Quinta Avenida (5th Avenue) and just off there are plenty of Mexican and Italian restaurants bars and shops nearby. In the front office Karina and Amira went out of their way to help with advice navigating the town. There is plenty of shopping, beach and side trips from Playa del Carmen. Try taking a Colectivo (a transportation van that runs up and down Highway 307 every 15 minutes or so) down to the ruins of Tulum. Grab a cab from Tulum to Gran Cenote which is a great freshwater place to snorkel or dive.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK”
Reviews.Author: lunytravelers
Reviews.Content: The location was too far from the beach for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great little nook in the town of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: moe1106
Reviews.Content: What a sweet place. It is charming, has a lot of character, friendly service, and was very intimate. We stayed at the very top room of the hotel so we could see the ocean. There are only a few rooms in this place but it's located down where all the action is in Playa. They offer a complimentary breakfast and check out is at 1. It is a little noisy outside so as a courtsey they give you earplugs for your night's sleep. I loved this place for its charm, atmosphere and uniqueness. Beach is within a VERY short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “incredible value for simple and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: londontraveller1000
Reviews.Content: Lunata doesn't need another great review, but we had such a great week there that I feel moved to add my praise. We had a room at the back looking onto the green and calming gardens. We had no problem at all with noise back there apart from the distant hum of the town. It was simply and stylishly decorated and very clean. All the staff were very helpful and genuinely friendly. If you're don't want a cheap hostel and you don't think it worth paying for the pretentious chillax hotels then I highly recommend lunata. Shame it's in Playa del Carmen which is a bit like disney by the sea and the food over priced. (can I have a decent glass of wine please?)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well run hotel - and a great value.”
Reviews.Author: SueNord
Reviews.Content: I just took my daughter and a friend to Playa del Carmen and we stayed at the Hotel Lunata. It was well-run, beautiful, very clean, and very hospitable. Upon our arrival they upgraded my daughter and her friend to a larger room (which was wonderful, as two teenagers really spread out). Both rooms faced Avenida Quinta, the busy shopping street, which was noisy. However, my daughter slept well without earplugs and I slept well with the earplugs the hotel leaves on the bedside table. If you're sensitive to noise, they do have rooms facing the back of the hotel. Breakfast was included in the price and while not special (toast, sweet rolls, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea) it was certainly adequate and served in the lovely garden.

Reviews.Title: “We miss the girls”
Reviews.Author: bostonbobby
Reviews.Content: This hotel of only 10 rooms is a diamond in the ruff. First and foremost the three girls that run reception are 2nd to NONE. Hi Amira, Karina and Fabiola if you're reading this. We truely miss you allot. We stayed at Lunata for two awesome weeks in the 5th ave rooms and the garden facing rooms. We liked the garden rooms Only because of the bigger balcony. Noise didn't bother us in either room. Yes the Carnivale week was loud for four nights but anywhere in Playa was loud those nights. It was CARNAVALE!! Great showers; clean rooms and hotel; beautiful accents ; perfect location and did I mention the girls that run the place? Oh yes I did, but I can't say enough. It was so hard to say good-bye. You can't go wrong chosing this place to stay. We have stayed at others so we know..

Reviews.Title: “We love the Lunata!!”
Reviews.Author: Cold-n-MN
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Playa Del Carmen on Monday. We stayed at the Hotel Lunata for 1 week. This is our 5th time staying at this hotel. He love the location and especially love our friends who work there - Corrina and Amyra. These two are gems. Both are very knowledgeable about the area and very helpful if you have any questions or need anything at all. They are always smiling. The hotel is very charming - nice decor and extremely clean. It is nice to be able to walk 5th Avenue at night - something new everytime you go out the door. The restaraunt across the street is excellent - Casa Mediterania - the best Italian food. We brought friends with last November when we stayed and they cannot wait to return. This was our daughters first stay there - she loved it as well. Thanks Lunata for another wonderful vacation. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay...”
Reviews.Author: kzdallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lunata last week for Carnivale. The hotel is lovely with beautiful decorations, a pretty garden, nice architecture and colors throughout. The location is excellent for strolling down 5th Avenue with all the shops, restaurants, etc. a few steps away. The beach is only a short walk, plenty of places to change currency, an internet cafe just around the corner. We loved the Yaxche restaurant close by -- the only one in town, I think, that is authentic Yucatecan food. The service in the hotel was excellent, the rooms were clean, and we enjoyed the Carnivale parades from the stoop in front of our hotel. The only problem that some folks might have is the noise. Be sure to get a room facing the garden if you're a light sleeper. Unfortunately, the garden room didn't help us because the Carnivale activities were going on a couple of blocks from the hotel (in an area facing the garden or back of the hotel) and they kept going until 3 a.m. One night I couldn't sleep; the next I slept like a log. So...just depends on your habits. Still, I'd go back in a minute and do it all over. It was such fun. When we were leaving at the airport we met a couple who had been to Playa for a week and stayed in a big resort on the beach and didn't even know Carnivale was going on! What they missed...I wouldn't have missed it for the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: CoronaWithLime
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff just took first place away from the doorman at the Ruben in London. Very pleased with the assistance with a variety of requests. Enjoyed a 5th Avenue room for people watching, but it is really loud. If you are not a sound sleeper consider one of the garden facing rooms. $179 per night is a bit high, considering that there is no ocean view or beach access, but the location on 5th Avenue will command a premium. Similar hotels are available for less. Depends on whether you are willing to pay extra for the location. We will opt for a beachfront next trip. In Jaunary of 2009, Playa del Carmen beaches are deteriorating badly. The beach south of Senior Frogs, which was about 50 yards of white sand when I started going to Plays, is gone completely. Large portions of the beaches to the north are now composed of exposed rock.

Reviews.Title: “Lunata”
Reviews.Author: Traveler-70005
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is very beautiful (if you like the Mexican hacienda look) and very clean. Beds were stiff- the norm in Playa. You are blocks away from everything. My friend and I were very pleased with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: beckarh
Reviews.Content: I walked by this beautiful hotel that is located on 5th Avenue right in the heart of Playa del Carmen. The hotel has a quaint and cozy courtyard and is beatifully decorated. I was greeted by Karina, the yound lady at the front desk. Karina is kind and sweet and extremely helpful. She walked me up to my room, to the top floor, and was able to answer all my questions. The room was simple, but beautifully decorated an very comfortable. The small patio was overlooking the street and it was not noisy like i had anticipated. The window opened up over the courtyard for a nice breeze. The bathroom was beautifully tiled. The room had air conditioning. Oh, and there was roof access just for that room that had lounge chairs. It was only $79/night for a room with a queen bed. It was walking distance (really, not far at all) to the beach. It is the perfect Playa del Carmen hotel to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lunata fell short”
Reviews.Author: TrvlJnky
Reviews.Content: There are some things to recommend Hotel Lunata - great location on 5th Ave, excellent staff, lovely surroundings/decor - but I don't think it was worth the price paid. I felt like we could've spent less money and gotten the same benefits elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good value, big rooms, HUGE beds!”
Reviews.Author: passi0n4travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in June 2008. It was fab! We turned up on the day and they gave us a special cheap room rate, as it was last minute. The room itself was massive with lots of storage space and the biggest bed I've ever seen! The decor was was Mexican...browns, greens, blues, reds etc. None of this minimalist rubbish.......Very tastefully done. The bathroom had a lovely powerful & hot shower, I liked the decor in the bathroom. The room had climate control .... so you could select the temperature you wanted in to be. This was great as it meant that you didn't wake up freezing after leaving the Air-con on full whack. The climate control was much quieter than regular aircon so it didn't interupt your sleep. The Hotel overlooks the main street in Playa del Carmen, so it was lovely to sit out of the balcony & people watch, before getting ready for a night out. This makes it a bit noisey when trying to get to sleep, but the hotel provided earplugs to help with this. That siad, I had one of the best nights sleep I had in ages as the bed was sooooo very comfy, the temperature was perfect and there was not the constant whirring of an air-con unit. The minibar is very reasonably priced. Complimentary breakfast is on offer .... this includes toast & jam, cereal, tea, coffee & juice. Its not super exciting or posh but if you are on a budget then its a free meal! Breakfast is served in the garden, which is very nice. The rooms are upstairs and I don't think that there is a lift so it might be tricky for people in wheelchairs or with limited mobility. The staff were very helpful, especially with helping to carry bags up the stairs and recommending places to go. The beach is very close by, only a few minutes walk away. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lakata
Reviews.Content: We stumbled into this hotel when our beach front hotel (Mimi del Mar) was booked and we couldn't extend our stay there. This hotel was very nice. Pluses: very English fluent and very nice front desk great central air conditioning, meaning *no noise* from the AC very new rooms tastefully decorated, good size beautiful garden and hacienda like entry way nice bathrooms right in the middle of 5th avenue action Minuses: right in the middle of 5th avenue action - noisy but not too bad (they do provide ear plugs) not on the beach lots of stairs (if you are mobility impaired) There is discounted parking lot ($5USD per day) on the back side of the block, so you would have to walk around the block to get to your car. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It was just the right hotel for Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: californiasgold
Reviews.Content: In a totally uncharacteristic move, my boyfriend and I pulled into Playa del Carmen without a room reservation. We stumbled on the Lunata rather by accident (sort of...we had some impromptu help from the starred listing in the guide book), and got a room for about $100 U.S., which included tax and a light breakfast. We were most impressed with the room! Gorgeous brick ceiling and tiled bathroom, plus pretty furnishings...and a wonderful balcony onto the main drag, Avenida 5. (Theoretically, this could be a negative because of the noise, but perhaps Playa del Carmen is an unwise choice if serenity is really what you want...we'd just come from Tulum, and Playa seemed like a bustling metropolis in comparison.) I believe Pandora was the name of our top-floor room, and I'd say, for the price, you can't beat it...but be mindful that there are no elevators, so my guy summoned his strength to carry all our stuff up all the stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: cozy1
Reviews.Content: Regretfully, My husband had just a very brief stay at the Lunata. As other reviewers have stated--it is difficult to find anything new to say. We loved our stay. I had read about Lunata on Tripadvisor and on my last trip to Playa, I was one of those people who stepped inside the property to get a better look. It was perfectly perfect. During our stay I was happy to speak to other "visitors" about the hotel. So what can I add? We had a suite facing the courtyard with two double beds and a balcony during the first week in Feb. When we had to change our plans , well in advance of that week, the staff was very accomodating. I took beautiful pictures, but you've already seen the same type of beautiful pictures on this site. The hotel may want to include some of those type of shots on it's web page - especially the entrance hallway with the garden glowing in the back and the stairway angle looking down to the lobby at night. Those shots sold me! When we first arrived, we were very early and the staff allowed us to leave our two pieces of luggage in the office. We felt that our belongings were safe. When we checked in, the woman behind the desk walked up to our room with us along with the nice man carrying our luggage. The maid introduced herself to us in the lobby. The (19 year old?) girl at the desk took the time to recommend where I could buy a bracelet like hers for my teen daughter. I only wish we would have been there long enough, and my memory would have been "fresh" enough, to remember all of their names! There were really no big surprises. They didn't have a hair dryer and I knew that was a possibility. I also knew that I might have to bring hair conditioner and lotion. Honestly, I can't remember now if they had those or not. I think not. I will describe, though ,the setting of the courtyard/hotel because I'm not sure it's been done yet. From past pictures, I thought that the building was in a "U' sape with the courtyard in the middle. Actually, the hotel is just one rectangular building and the buildings on each side in the back are separate businesses. One side was a villa/condo type of building and I can't remember the other side. Our balcony was on that second side and what we saw was the roof of that building to the right and the roof of another building beyond that. To our left, we could see the garden below and a glimpse of the condo type building. I also wanted to mention to the people who book rooms on the street. If you long for a balcony facing the quiet courtyard for those "ah" moments, I believe there was one at the end of one of the halls. It was not attached to any rooms. You may want to check with the hotel first (to make sure it is open to all) if this is an important part of your room decision. We slept great and noise was not a factor when we were there. We did have the air on when we slept but I don't remember the noise "bothering "us on our balcony earlier in the evening. Personally, I like to be in a cabin/lodge/tent in the western US, an inn/cottage/ b and b in New England, and anything "adobe" in the southwest. In other countries, I do my research to get my dose of local "flavor". Some of my choices are very ,very modest and some are on the indulgent side. We stayed at a funky, modest, beach hotel on this same trip to Playa. Next trip, we're going to one of Playa's thatched roof type of places. For our "hacienda" feel, Lunata was absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “What else can I say?”
Reviews.Author: L4R
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this hotel are pretty much across the board fantastic and I don't have much to add or change about that. It really doesn't get much better for the price. My boyfriend and I stayed in the Pandora room, which faces the street. My only warning would be that if you are a light or sensitive sleeper, you should probably make sure you book a room facing the garden, because there is some noise from the bar across the street (Bourbon Street) until about midnight and from people in general strolling down 5th Avenue. We did our homework and knew this going in, and since we're not light sleepers, it didn't bother us one bit. Just make sure to confirm what room you're in if that's the kind of thing that might bother you! Anyway, the rooms are spotless, updated and completely charming. Pandora doesn't have a fridge, which would be a nice touch, but it does have a small cable TV, a nice safe and air conditioning that works a lot better than my central air at home! The staff is a joy to deal with, everyone is cheerful and friendly. They provide a large bottle of water everyday, which is a lifesaver, trust me. The front desk staff speaks perfect English and really work hard to make your stay perfect. The hotel is in a great location. The beaches can get very crowded, especially at the beach clubs further North, but if you stay in the area between the ferry and Lunata, it's much more peaceful and you can even find some natural shade under the palm trees so you don't need to search up and down the beach in vain for a palapa. There doesn't seem to be a way to leave restaurant/bar reviews for PDC on this site, so I'll make some recommendations in this space. The first meal we had was the fish and shrimp tacos (fried) at Fusion Hotel just around the corner from Lunata and right on the beach. It was one of the best meals we had the entire week and we really liked the staff as well. I think our very favorite restaurant was La Fe, which is about a 10 minute slow walk from Lunata up on the northern end. Prices here are extremely reseasonable and everything we had the 3 times we ate there was outstanding. I highly recommend the shrimp burritos, fried potato tacos and the chicken wrapped with bacon. It has a really relaxed, hipster lounge feel to it as well. If you're looking for a great, cheap place on the beach for seafood, definitely try La Tarraya, not far at all from Lunata if you walk on the beach toward the south end of 5th ave. I loved their shrimp ceviche in an avocado. To be honest, you really cannot go wrong with shrimp anywhere in PDC, it seems to be one of the things most places do very well. Our favorite bar was Pez y Vela, a couple minutes walk from Lunata towards the south end of 5th. They have swing seats at the bar and the bartenders here were our favorites by far. It's really the kind of place you can go and hang out for hours on end. The patrons are extremely friendly (not sure why everyone we seemed to meet there was from Wisconsin, but we loved them!), the people watching is great and the bartenders are fast and very entertaining. I loved their frozen strawberry margaritas and the food was actually quite good. We loved the the queso fundido, which was very simple but so tasty. I know a lot of regular PDC-goers are big Tequila Barrel fans, but to us, this bar kicked its butt. I'll also recommend the YucaTrek tours we booked through playa.info. The Tulum tour was really cool, but I think if you do one tour, make it the Chichen Itza tour!

Reviews.Title: “A Savior!”
Reviews.Author: dcanepa
Reviews.Content: After a most unsatisfying one night at the Hotel Colibri, we walked over to Lunata and they couldn't have been more helpful to us. They had no rooms, but made several phone calls to local hotels and secured a room for us, at La Tortuga, which was fabulous. The only problem was that Tortuga could only accommodate us for 3 days, but we were able to book at Lunata after that. At Lunata, our room was spacious, clean, and well-appointed with Mexican art. The staff was always very friendly and helpful to us. The garden patio is a beautiful oasis to get away from the busy 5th avenue. The breakfast needs some work, however. Even the name "Continental Breakfast" is an exaggeration. In summary, this is a nice hotel and a good value, right in the heart of the bustle of 5th avenue. Don

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lunata!”
Reviews.Author: demoizelle
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Lunata was almost perfect. As many others have noted, rooms on 5th Avenue can be a little noisy but between the tv and earplugs (provided by the hotel), it's tolerable and some nites, not an issue at all. We stayed 5 nites and found it very easy to settle in and feel right at home. Staff was super friendly and helped create that homey sort of feel. The garden is gorgeous and actually attracts passing tourists looking for a good photo op. Breakfast isn't anything to write home about but, just steps away there are countless restaurants serving affordable (and overpriced) meals so you won't go hungry. Look forward to visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me...maybe the right hotel for you?”
Reviews.Author: DaynaUsa
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. The hotel room overall was clean except for the hair in the bed, maybe the maids? This hotel is centrally located on 5th AVE which means you can also hear all of the noise from the street throughout the night, but the hotel does provide free earplugs. And rooms facing the garden may be quieter. I was disappointed with my stay for the following: as we had an early morning check out we happened to witness a man bringing in a hooker into the hotel and I'm not exactly sure if he was actually a guest at the hotel or simply making a deal with the night security guard. We witnessed this lady saying vulgar things and making payment arrangements with her client. Then speaking in Spanish to the guard and being let in. If I'd known Hotel Lunata was this type of hotel I would have stayed elsewhere. The hotel website makes the hotel appear classy. I would not stay here again because of this one incident, but also because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful intimate hacienda style hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalgarySue
Reviews.Content: The Lunata is a 10 room hacienda-style hotel on the main strip in Playa Del Carmen - 5th Avenue. It is centrally located, walking distance to everything! Fantastic restaurants, ferry to Cozumel etc. are all within 10 minutes walk, with silver and other shops right outside the front door. The rooms are beautifully decorated with mexican-style furnishings and tile, and are spotlessly cleaned each day. We had the top room in the hotel (which is like a 3 storey hacienda) with a beautiful brick-domed ceiling. Our room faced 5th Avenue, which made it a little noisy (but which was easy to get used to); however we could see all up and down the Avenue from our balcony and also a view of the ocean. We had the smallest room with a small stand-up balcony - some of the larger rooms have actual terraces to sit on - and either face 5th Avenue or the hotel's small, charming garden in the back. The smallest rooms do not have a mini-fridge, which we have recommended they put in. The larger rooms do. The breakfast each day, available in the garden at your convenience, included coffee, milk, juices, cereal, toast and various sweet buns - good to get you on your way each day. The staff are WONDERFUL - friendly, helpful and lots of fun. The hotel has a locked gate at night, with a security guard, so we felt very safe. Beautiful little spot to stay in - we were there nine nights and sad to leave - will definitely stay there again! Sue and Bob

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: shora73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lunata in November. We had the room facing the street and although it was a bit noisy it wasn't that bad. The hotel is very clean and bright and the staff is very friendly and helpful, especially when it comes to giving directions. The hotel's location can't be beat as it is right in the heart of it all but the beach is right around the corner. All in all, a very nice place to stay and the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Gem on the 5th”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler1207
Reviews.Content: My wife and I originally planned to stay right on the city, because some of my friends told me that it's really amazing and it is, from outside you can see the main entrance as one of the ancient mexican asiendas(or something like that) and the coolest ambience inside of the hotel, the staff is very friendly and helpful there's one girl on the frontdesk called karyna and she helped us all the time with some tours to Chichen Itza(wow) and Xcarel and the best restaurants in town, ask her if you need something, cleaning staff kept the room very clean, best place in town to retreat from a long day around the riviera maya Thank You Lunata

Reviews.Title: “True Oasis”
Reviews.Author: ZorroAca
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel with class .... you can tell that the builders followed the architects dream. Great Spanish style with special touches at every eye turn. Very clean & very romantic. The staff are quite delightful. All of this while being right on 5th Ave. where the action is in Playa. I was there on business and I head back next week .... if they have a room .... that's where I will be!!!!!!! Garry

Reviews.Title: “Don't Tell Everyone....Best Kept Secret...”
Reviews.Author: LAWOMAN65
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lunata was absolutely fabulous...My husband begged me not to tell anyone...just 10 gorgeous rooms, you feel like you're in a bed and breakfast. The hotel is beautiful, clean and the staff is kind and so helpful. We go to Playa del Carmen every year and have stayed in many cool places, LUNATA takes the cake....so affordable, the back rooms look on to a lush garden and are quiet, but the front rooms are abit noisy if you plan on going to bed early. Not a problem for us, since we partied at a different lounge everynight. We got great massages in the garden and they were very cheap compared to the states, 1 hour for $45 dollars. Breakfast is simple but good, and a great time to meet the other guests, from all over the world, we loved that we can walk right over to the beach within 2 minutes but did not have to deal with all the noise from the beach bars till 4 am and the mites. (did that last year) . Lunata also had GREAT air conditioning...a must. I highly recommend Lunata, we already booked for next year so I don't mind sharing the great tip.

Reviews.Title: “Great small friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruebrezin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lunata in Nov 2006 while attending our nephew's Playa del Carmen wedding. A first trip to Mexico for us and what a great hotel in which to experience Mexico's offerings! The hotel staff was 150% attentive, always helpful in answering any questions we had. Our room, Ofelia, was large and garden-facing. We felt quite at home here. Our son and his future wife have now booked their honeymoon at the Hotel Lunata based on our enjoyment of the hotel, its quaintness, cleanliness, staff and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Accomidations”
Reviews.Author: karenrobbins
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via tripadvisor, so are happy to add something else. Stayed at the Lunata for 2/4 days that we stayed in Playa del Carmen in early April 2007. Overall, very happy with the value--approx $119/night for a large room with soaring ceiling ("Pandora") overlooking 5th ave/la quinta. Small television if you want to watch that. Very clean, comfortable, and right in the middle of everything. Of course with that, comes drawbacks (noise) but I think this may be minimized if you pay more for the rooms not facing the street. Very nice front desk personel, very helpful. They give complementary earplugs and bottled water, a nice touch. Usually, the party music outside started around 9AM, typically a sound off between Brazilian music (courtousy of Brasil 10) and American [--] from Bourban Street, however I didn't really have too much of a problem sleeping in. I think it was worth it for Lunata's great location. No pool, nor passes to the beach clubs (you can pay for these if you go there) but nice areas to lounge. Bathrooms clean, decent water pressure, no problems with hot water. They tell you there is a 'simple' breakfast, but don't be fooled--it's great (for what you pay--nothing!!!) Also nice place to meet other hotel guests, who were there from the States, Mexico, Europe.... Overall, this is a simple, comfortable place with good value to stay in the heart of Playa del Carmen

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place- March 18-25”
Reviews.Author: bgill8
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for us to stay for our first visit to PDC. It was in our budget and the place couldn't have been better! We had a room facing 5th ave and we weren't bothered by the noise at all. That's not to say that it wasn't noisy at all, but we aren't the type of people that go to bed at 10 and stay in our room all day. Staying at Lunata made the whole trip seem more cultural. We didn't want to stay in an Americanized resort while in Mexico. Great water pressure in the shower, very very clean, and the ac worked almost too good! Location was amazing, right in the middle of everything on 5th ave, and one block from the beach. No need at all for a pool. Our friends stayed at a hotel that had a pool and not only did they not use it, it was very very small about 6ft by 6ft. Staff was great,very helpful, and spoke very good english! The only downfall at Lunata was that the bed was a little hard. But overall we will definitely be staying there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oakton
Reviews.Content: We vacationed in Playa del Carmen March 8th-13th and had a marvelous time. We found Hotel Lunata to be a perfect oasis from 5th Avenue and had no problem with noise in our garden view room. Melissa and the rest of the staff are amazing and full of information. We were aided in renting a vehicle, with dinner recommendations, day trip plans and airport transportation. Prior to our arrival fruit, chips, water and beer were purchased for our room with payment on arrival. The hotel and grounds were spotless and we appreciated fresh coffee, breads and cereals in the morning. Our college age daughter traveled with us and she loved Hotel Lunata's location. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but excruciatingly noisy”
Reviews.Author: AntoinetteM
Reviews.Content: At the end of a wonderful 3-week trip to the Yucatan, we stayed 5 nights at Lunata. Yes it is lovely and the staff is friendly and helpful. We had read positive reviews about an "oasis of calm" and were astounded by its location in the midst of what felt like the noisiest street in the world-La Quinta Avenida. From 8pm to 2am, loud music and partying tourists all compete in a mad atonal symphony of constant noise. Then the street cleaners come. This is fine if you intend to party all night. (The back rooms are better than the front.) Almost at once, we asked to be released from our last 2 nights only, but mgt. would not allow, though it was a busy holiday weekend. And the $155 price seemed high compared with other more appealing places we'd stayed. So we were unhappy and very much do not recommend the Lunata. Our very last night, we stayed at the Cancun Omni for a similar price. Oh, blessed quiet at night! For a true oasis at half the price, try Merida's Medio Mundo. Or visit wondrous Palenque and stay at the beautiful hotel Ciudad Real, also cheaper. All of these have swimming pools too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: JZinSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for New Years 2006 for three nights and loved the hotel. The design of the hotel is first class and feels like mexico. We were really impressed with our room "Europa" on the garden side which is supposed to quieter and it was. The hotel is right on 5th street which made it easy to stroll along the shops and restaraunts. We never wished we had stayed on the beach. The service was excellent and they were very helpful with recommending some very good restaurants. This place just "gets it". Go and you won't be dissapointed. Thanks Hotel Lunata for doing it right!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnaaries
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lunata's prime location is both a blessing and a curse. The location right now Quinta Avenida lends to easy access to the beach and night life. However, it also comes at the curse of loud music and construction (going on next door when we stayed and apparently construction workers in Mexico work sun rise to after sun set) serenading you to sleep. The grounds of the hotel are gorgeous, luscious gardens and adorable Mexican details everywhere. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful in making recommendations around town and answering your questions. Breakfast is provided but is very simple. If simple sweet breads and coffee isn't enough for you, there are plenty of cafes closeby to get breakfast. Parking is kind of a pain for Lunata since Quinta Avenida is pedestrian only. The parking for the hotel is actually on 10th Avenue ($5/day) so you end up having to haul your luggage 2 blocks from the car to the hotel. Also to note that since Lunata only has narrow stairwells, the hotel is extremely inaccessible for handicapped people.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Butcher.T
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a stay at the Lunata. The people there, Melissa and Monica, were extemely nice and very helpful. The grounds are well kept and the rooms are very clean. We had friends that stayed at a much more expensive hotel and had such bad service they were sorry they didn't stay with us at the Lunata. In fact one couple did change from their hotel to the Lunata. The breakfast is a continental style breakfast with rolls, toast and/or cereal, two juices and coffee - plenty to get you started for the day and if you like a bigger breakfast the staff is always there to help you find a nice place. A free liter of water was supplied to us each day. We were there for a wedding and the staff would always make a point of asking how things were going and how the wedding was. The whole experience was a pleasure and I would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lunata is great”
Reviews.Author: vicnric
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Hotel Lunata. We like it because it is located in the heart of Playa del Carmen but is very quiet. It is a short walk to restaurants, shops, the beach, an ATM and the bus station. It is a small hotel with 10 rooms that are very beautifully appointed. It is kept clean but we found on this trip that the room we stayed in before had some minor repairs that needed tending to. The hot water faucet didn't work and the door to the balcony didn't lock. The faucet was promptly fixed but the lock was looked at and not repaired in the week we were there, however a broom handle was given to us to wedge in the door. Security in this case would not have been an issue considering it was a third floor balcony. We also noticed that the linens have a lot of stains which we didn't notice the time before but other than that they are clean. The staff is excellent, helpful and friendly. They all speak English and have a lot of knowledge of the area. We have enjoyed our stay both times and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a boutique hotel at its finest”
Reviews.Author: brunettegirl_7
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel after we booked ourselves at another hotel. Instantly I fell in love with it and wanted to stay here instead...so we did and it was fabulous. The courtyard is cute and quant, the staff is helpful and friendly and the location is fabulous. I loved the little decorative details like the lights in the foyer and brick details. I didn't find the noise at all an issue even with a room facing the street...and for really light sleepers just bring a set of earplugs and you'll hear absolutely nothing. Fantastic hotel, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Bueno!”
Reviews.Author: lf644
Reviews.Content: This is the most marvelous hotel! The staff at this hotel where so helpful. We needed our laundry done. We dropped it off at the front desk and it was done that night...For like six bucks. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Book this hotel early as the good rooms (meaning the quiet ones that aren't on the street) go early. The Brazilian bikini shop across the street blares music all night long. If your room is on the street good luck sleeping before 4am. The rooms are so sweet and charming. There are nice fridges and TV's. The continental breakfast is lacking but, sufficent. We loved this hotel for it's location, staff, and overall charm. Playa ia a world away from Cancun.....Not as touristy and a more mature sophisticated crowd with the restaurants and shops to match. Reminded me of a lovely town in Spain. Friendly people, wonderful beaches, and food. Playa is so much better than Cancun! The staff at Lunata will give you great tour and resturant advice so don't be afraid to pick their brains! There is so much to do and see! It is so kick back here a place to de-stress for sure! Get out from behind that desk and put your sandals on. Get ready to not ever want to come home!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: srlaries
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, economical, and in a good location although I will warn you of the noise and the HARD beds. We stayed in the Ophelia Room which faced the garden and the noise on the street was at times unbareable and the beds are harder than a rock. My back still aches!

Reviews.Title: “It was superb!”
Reviews.Author: grandmajanie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Lunata in Playa del Carmen from March 25th, 2006 until April 1st, 2006. It was nirvana. It is a small boutique hotel with only 10 rooms. My room was on the top floor (climbing all those stairs took some getting used to) and faced the hotel's magnificent garden. When my friend and I arrived at the hotel we were warmly greeted by Monica. (She and Melissa were inspirations and great resources throughout our stay.) When we arrived in our room we were thrilled that it was exactly as had been described. The room is wonderfully appointed. I loved the beamed ceiling, the tiles, the stucco.... The safe in the closet served well as a place to put valuables. The refrigerator was a good size and kept things cold (unlike so many other hotels in which I have stayed). The air-conditioning worked efficiently. The deck was a pleasant place to relax. The bed was very comfortable. Since the hotel is located right on 5th Avenue it was interesting to sit near the garden in the courtyard and watch people just wander through the arch with great looks of surprise. It really feels like paradise when you enter from the hot, busy street. We did not eat the continental breakfast at the hotel, but a lovely protected area in the garden is designated for the guests to dine. I look forward to my return. It was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vegtravel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights at Hotel Lunata in March. We stayed in the room called, "Pandora". Pandora had a queen bed, small balcony, beautiful dome roof, and awesome shower (great water pressure)! Overall: - Great staff! They were more than happy to assist us with finding restaurants and/or off the beaten path locations within Playa. Always smiling and honestly happy to help. - Clean room, great views. One may have a problem if you do not like to be in the center of town. Since Lunata is right on 5th, it does stay busy late 11-12pm so you may hear people waltzing by. But, early in the morning is not a problem- as most of the shops only start opening around 8-9 am or so, and the tourists don't emerge till 10am to start their shopping! - Cable TV- yes I'll admit, after being without it for 4 previous days it was nice to have TV access if I wanted it! - Coffee and sweet breads in the morning which was a nice light touch to start the day! - Lovely garden with trees and green green grass! - Complimentary 1 liter of bottled water everyday in our room.

Reviews.Title: “The Good Life”
Reviews.Author: Xcalacoco
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from a great week at the Lunata. An example of traditional Mexican beauty and a comfortable haven with reasonable rates. We watched the Carnaval Parades and pedestrians from our balcony over 5th Av. Some nights the bands down the street were extra noisy. That's why the earplugs are provided. There are quieter rooms with different views. There were complimentary sweet rolls, cereal, toast, fresh juice, and coffee in the garden daily with the butterflies. There is a parking lot behind the hotel on 10th Av. that has special, guest rates. The traffic police will let you drive down 8th St. to unload your bags half a block away. Without hesitation, we would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great place !”
Reviews.Author: martyspaulding
Reviews.Content: Some people would probably whine about : 1) It's on a pedestrian-only street, so you have to carry your luggage a block or two to get there. 2) It's on the second, third and fourth floors, so you have to climb a lot of stairs. (No ... there isn't an elevator) 3) There are lots of restaurants and clubs nearby that are busy til 11pm or so. If these three things bother you, then please GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. The all-inclusive fat-lazy-tourist places with no character are just up the street. That way there will be a room next time I want to come back to Lunata! Hotel Lunata ROCKS. The rooms are spotless and comfy, there are great restaurants, beaches, nightlife and shopping within steps of the front door. I can't imagine staying anywhere else if and when we return to Playa del Carmen. The staff is polite and helpful, the decor is vibrant and warm, and the location is dead center in the Fifth Avenue district. The only suggestion I would have for management would be adding some internet capabilities in the rooms (wireless ?). Other than that, it's PERFECT !

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: _jd1973
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here in Playa this month and was under-whelmed. Our room stank (a dirty musty smell), shower rail fell down while taking a shower and our balcony door would not lock. I asked the receptionist Mellisa for a lock for our in-room-safe and was told she didn't have any left?When I told her I needed something to lock the door (since we had no safe) she brought up a broom handle. I got the impression she really didn't give a damn.. Breakfast was miserable - terrible coffee and a loaf of bread on a communal garden table. I get the impression that this place might have been great a few years ago but is in a slow decline. The only saving grace for Lunata is the location and nice entrance and courtyard they have. I would not stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Playa Jewel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Lunata this past May. It was lovely. The decor of the hotel is very tasteful and beautifully reflects Mexican arts. Inlaid pebbles in the floor, interesting art on the walls, etc. Whenever we lingered at the entry area, people walking down the street would wander in because they were so impressed and suprised by this little jewel in the middle of the busy 5th Ave. area. As an example of the craftsmanship, we asked the owner about the arched concrete that is used in many areas of the hotel. My husband who is an architect was sure it was cast that way, we wondered how they got the texture on it. The owner explained they brought in craftsmen from another area of Mexico, and it was all hand chiseled - and there was a lot of it. So if you enjoy authentic details, this hotel has many. Communicating with the staff was no problem. The manager and front desk staff could not have been more helpful. From restaurant suggestions, to where the locals shop for basic things like hair clips - every question answered with a smile. Our favorite restaurant for dinner was Ula Gula, just down the street a few blocks, on the corner, open air second floor dining room overlooking the street scene. Very romantic, great food, lovely. The hotel was spotless. Very clean, absolutely no problem there. The air conditioning was powerful, and cooled rooms quickly. It was very hot even in May, but you get into a different rhythm. For us we slept late, getting up just in time to eat the breakfast provided in the garden. (Very basic continental, but good - Mexican pastries, cereal, juice and coffee - sufficient.) Spent the hot day at the beach. The beach club they give a discount to is nice. Never a problem getting a chair or palupa. Reading, swimming, being served lunch or snacks (for reasonable price) at your beach chair - it doesn't get much better than that. Around 6 or 7 we went back to the hotel, showered and went out for dinner at about 8. By then it had cooled down. Other tips- for phones, go to nearest corner, turn toward beach to the internet shop. Cheaper long distance than phone cards. Day trips we did that were good - Tulum & Xcaret (sp?) in one day - fun. Xcaret was all food and drinks included. Take ferry to Cozumel one day. We went snorkeling, submarine (expensive, but worth it), and a bit of shopping. If you want souveniers that are more upscale, go to "100% Mexico" in the newer shopping area by the dock to Cozumel (you can walk), the sell nice things all made by Mexican craftsmen. Yes, it's a bit noisy, but didn't keep us up. At the price, I don't think you can find a nicer place. It is charming.

Reviews.Title: “Real mexican feeling”
Reviews.Author: cibonet
Reviews.Content: I visited the splendid Lunata with my wife on our honeymoon….what can I say ???? Wonderful location…a real Mexican feeling…with very happy and always helpful staff..they made our holiday special..thank guys….Massimo e Katie

Reviews.Title: “Que buenisima! What a great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HarvestMoon
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's first trip out of the country and I wanted to make sure this was a good experience for him. When I travel, I want to know I am staying in another country, not waking up in a hotel that could be anywhere in the US. We decided on 6 nights PDC/Hotel Lunata and 3 nights splurging at the Hilton-Cancun in a villa. This was the perfect balance of experiences. The Lunata is the most gorgeous small hotel and a wonderful place to experience Mexico. Even my very american "why-go-to-another-country" husband loved it. You can't beat the location. Just step out of the door on to the pedestrian street of 5th Ave and everything is right there. The people in PDC are so welcoming and fun to be around. There are so many great restaurants on the Avenida that you will have a hard time trying to choose where to eat. The hotel, even though it is small, is lush and oozing with Mexican charm. The room's air conditioning held up great at all times even with 100% humidity almost every day. The employees were very helpful and we always felt safe. We slept in a king room on the street and only had a problem with noise on the first night (we were overly tired from travelling). It really wasn't bad enough to keep us up the other nights. We thought the king room was worth it for the wet bar and extra space but everyone should be aware that the "balcony" is really just a strip with a rail that is big enough to squeeze one chair sideways. The rooms with true balconies facing the garden were nice but we enjoy people watching so we wanted a street side room. The bathroom was better (and cooler looking!) than my bathroom at home. Lots of tile everywhere, plenty of towels, good sized fridge, fresh bottled water every day. We didn't have a car so parking wasn't an issue. Because it is in the middle of 5th Ave, if you need to meet a tour or take the ferry, everything is only a 10 minute walk away as opposed to being at one end or the other of the Avenida. As another reviewer said, when we were there, lots of people stopped in and oohed and ahhed at the entry way mentioning that they had wished they had known about the Lunata before they came. If you don't mind not having room service,a phone in your room, or a pool and you want to experience Mexican charm, then choose the Lunata!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyFive5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! The location was terrific. It was right on 5th Avenue where everything happens. Some people have complained here about it being noisy. We had a garden view room and didn't notice a thing. The beach was a short two minute walk away. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. It had a walk-in tile shower which was unique. The staff was very friendly and always smiling, even when we got back at 4AM one night and the guard had to wake up and open the gate for us. The room had a balcony overlooking the garden with a swinging chair. I sat out there and enjoyed a Cuban cigar from the cigar store down the block while enjoying the beautiful weather. They provide breakfast, but it was just coffee and pastries, so we usually went somewhere else. My only complaint is that they charged a daily fee of 10 pesos for a beach towel. After paying a decent amount for the room, this should have been included.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelerguy3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. Service was always with a smile. The staff were very helpful. There is a convenient safe in the room. Air conditioning was silent (central air, not a wall unit). Cable television. Refrigerator for your water etc. Bed was very firm - they called it orthopedic. It was quite comfortable, but we are used to a firmer bed. The only drawbacks to this hotel is that it is right on 5th avenue, and sometimes the music and noise from the street was annoying. The door lock to the room was a bit flimsy, but they hire a guard to sit in the entrance way all night long. As a closing note, we noticed people throughout our stay that would walk into the lobby of our hotel and beg for a room so they could escape the hotel they were staying at. Many were disappointed that they didn't know about the Lunata until too late.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Lunata
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida 5 between Calle 6 and 8, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
